item.title: PyMOL
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: PyMOL is a molecular graphics system with an embedded Python interpreter designed for real-time visualization and rapid generation of high-quality molecular graphics images and animations. It can also perform many other valuable tasks (such as editing PDB files) to assist you in your research.

item.title: RnaViz
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: RnaViz is a user-friendly, portable, windows-type program for producing publication-quality secondary structure drawings of RNA molecules. Drawings can be created starting from DCSE alignment files if they incorporate structure information or from mfold ct files.

item.title: ProtoFit
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: ProtoFit is a tool for optimization of surface protonation models from acid-base titration data. Although ProtoFit is designed with the analysis of the proton buffering behavior of surfaces in mind, it can be used equally well for other substances such as a dissolved acids that reversibly exchanges protons with water.
